communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DHS FOIA Office Budgeting Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative, I request: 

1. Any record submitted to DHS HQ (including Congressional Affairs, Management & Analysis, and the Secretary and appropriate under-Secretary’s offices, DHS FOIA) by DHS agency subcomponents CBP, OIG, ICE, and USCIS that seek or justify requests for additional appropriated funds from Congress or in the Presidential budget proposal to help these subcomponents’ FOIA offices clear their backlogs, shorten processing times, process and release more records, and avoid costly FOIA litigation. Please task a search for the budget cycles covering fiscal years (FY) 19, 20, 21, 22, and 23. 

2. Any record showing requested budget increases for DHS, ICE, CBP, OIG or USCIS FOIA offices that were not fulfilled by Congress in the appropriations legislation for FY19-22. 

3. Any record showing the amount of additional appropriated funds estimated to be necessary to reduce the current backlogs, shorten processing times, and avoid costly litigation involving FOIA processing by CBP, ICE, OIG, DHS, and USCIS during FY19-23. 

4. Any record of DHS acknowledging, approving, or directing its agency subcomponents’ FOIA offices (ICE, OIG, CBP, USCIS, or DHS) to “process” only  500 pages of records per month in litigation.

5. Any record showing DHS agency subcomponents’ FOIA Office determinations that they  lack adequate resources to fulfill their statutory timing obligations were communicated by those agencies to DHS leadership and budgeting personnel. The subcomponents to be queried are iCE, CBP, OIG, USCIS, and DHS HQ.  Please query FY19-23.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-HQFO-00867
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Wolfrey: 

I hereby appeal the agency’s “too-broad” determination because it does not comport with 6 C.F.R. 5.3(b). I further appeal  the agency’s failure to categorize this “too-broad” determination as a denial and notify me of my right to appeal. And I appeal the agency’s failure to task an adequate search in response to this request. 

6 CFR Section 5.3(b) provides: 

(b) Description of records sought. Requesters must describe the records sought in sufficient detail to enable DHS personnel to locate them with a reasonable amount of effort. A reasonable description contains sufficient information to permit an organized, non-random search for the record based on the component's filing arrangements and existing retrieval systems. To the extent possible, requesters should include specific information that may assist a component in identifying the requested records, such as the date, title or name, author, recipient, subject matter of the record, case number, file designation, or reference number. Requesters should refer to appendix I of this subpart for additional component-specific requirements. In general, requesters should include as much detail as possible about the specific records or the types of records that they are seeking. Before submitting their requests, requesters may contact the component's FOIA Officer or FOIA public liaison to discuss the records they are seeking and to receive assistance in describing the records. If after receiving a request, a component determines that it does not reasonably describe the records sought, the component should inform the requester what additional information is needed or why the request is otherwise insufficient. Requesters who are attempting to reformulate or modify such a request may discuss their request with the component's designated FOIA Officer, its FOIA Public Liaison, or a representative of the DHS Privacy Office, each of whom is available to assist the requester in reasonably describing the records sought.

I am searching in vain to find any contact information you provided in your April 22, 2022, that would allow me, as a requestor, to “discuss [my] request with the component’s designated FOIA Officer, its FOIA Public Liaison, or a representative of the DHS FOIA Privacy Office, each of whom is available to assist [me] in reasonably describing the records sought.” 

DHS has offered no contact information in this letter for its Designated FOIA Officer, its FOIA Public Liaison, or a “representative of the DHS FOIA Privacy Office,” and as such, none of them are “available to assist” as your own regulations require. 

Please promptly remand this appeal with instructions to comply with the Department’s own FOIA regulations and the Act. 

Many thanks, 

Andrew Free
#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative
Al Otro Lado.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-HQFO-01079
communications.communication:
You have reached the SecureRelease™ Support Desk.

The purpose of this inbox is to provide technical support for the SecureRelease FOIA Request Portal website (https://www.securerelease.us/).



SecureRelease Support is not involved with the processing or prioritization of requests, and this inbox is not monitored by agency personnel. To ask for an update or discuss the specifics of your request(s), you must contact the agency directly.


If you submitted your request(s) through the SecureRelease™ Request Portal<https://www.securerelease.us/> or to a participating agency using FOIA.gov, you may use the SecureRelease Portal Messages feature to send electronic correspondence and attachments directly to the agency.



To send a portal message:



  1.  Sign in to the SecureRelease™ Request Portal: https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/
  2.  Click the My Requests icon
  3.  Locate the request you wish to inquire about, and click on the Request Number
  4.  From the request screen, click the Messages icon at the top of the page
  5.  Click the Add Message button at the upper right
  6.  Complete the required Message Fields
  7.  Drag and drop any Files you wish to attach into the file upload box (Optional)
     *   Maximum of 25 files can be attached to a message, and total file size cannot be more than 100 mb. Supported file formats: DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX, TXT, PDF, JPG, PNG, BMP and TIF/TIFF
  8.  Click Send
  9.  Return to the Messages tab within your Request to access outgoing and incoming messages


Should you have an inquiry related to your SecureRelease user account or concerning www.securerelease.us<http://www.securerelease.us>, please email us with the relevant details and a member of our support team will be happy to assist.



Take care,


SecureRelease™ Support Team
securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com<mailto:securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com>
www.securerelease.us<https://www.securerelease.us/>

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Janea Scott Peter H. Weiner
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all communications, including email attachments, between Janea Scott and any representative, official, or employee of the law firm Cox Castle Nicholson (including Peter H. Weiner). This request seeks records produced since January 1, 2020.

I am a reporter for The Guardian and The Nation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Alameda Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Alameda Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Blum

title: FOIA Requests (Occupational Safety and Health Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Requests (Occupational Safety and Health Administration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am searching for any and all documents regarding, evidencing, or detailing violations, warnings, cautions, fines, penalties, judgments, agency determinations, and/or enforcement inspections against the following entities at any time from 1972 to present:

-	BNSF Railway 
-	Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway
-	Burlington Northern Railroad
-	St. Louis–San Francisco Railway

This requests specifically seeks, but is not limited to, any records regarding violations, warnings, cautions, fines, testing, inspection, citations, survey work, agency recommendations/plans of action, or any communications with the above-named entity(-ies) regarding or related to violations of air quality, pollution, waste disposal, respiratory protection, workplace safety, and asbestos-related standards.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin LaMarca

communications.subject: Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Hello:

Your request has been assigned to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) with tracking number 2024-F-12503. When they begin processing it, you will be able to track its progress at https://efoia.dol.gov/App/CheckStatus.aspx. If you need to contact them about it for any reason, please submit your inquiry through osha.foia@dol.gov<mailto:osha.foia@dol.gov> or phone 202-693-1999. In addition, it would be helpful to include the tracking number in the Subject line of any email submission to have it available at the time of the call.

Sincerely,


Glenn Lewis
Government Information Specialist
Office of Information Services (OIS)
Division of Management and Administrative Legal Services (MALS)
U.S. Department of Labor, Office of the Solicitor
200 Constitution Ave NW,  Room N2424, Washington DC 20210
Phone: 202-693-5164
Email: lewis.glenn.m@dol.gov<mailto:lewis.glenn.m@dol.gov>
e-FOIAs: FOIArequests@dol.gov<mailto:FOIArequests@dol.gov>

communications.subject: 12503 - FOIA Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. LaMarca:

This letter is to acknowledge receipt of your July 18, 2024, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request, which was received in the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA), Directorate of Enforcement Programs (DEP) for response.  Please reference FOIA tracking number 2024-F-12503 in any future correspondence concerning this request.

You request the following:

I am searching for any and all documents regarding, evidencing, or detailing violations, warnings, cautions, fines, penalties, judgments, agency determinations, and/or enforcement inspections against the following entities at any time from 1972 to present:

- BNSF Railway
- Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway
- Burlington Northern Railroad
- St. Louis-San Francisco Railway

This requests specifically seeks, but is not limited to, any records regarding violations, warnings, cautions, fines, testing, inspection, citations, survey work, agency recommendations/plans of action, or any communications with the above-named entity(-ies) regarding or related to violations of air quality, pollution, waste disposal, respiratory protection, workplace safety, and asbestos-related standards.

We are currently processing your request.  DEP has an existing backlog of FOIA requests in queue received prior to yours, so there is an expected delay.  Additionally, all FOIAs are reviewed by the Office of the Solicitor prior to release, which may protract processing time.  Please keep these considerations in mind as you await your response.
Best regards,



April Streets
Government Information Specialist
Occupational Safety and Health Administration
Directorate of Enforcement Programs (DEP)
streets.april@dol.gov

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Boehm Family Files (National Security Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to read all of your files regarding myself and my immediate family, going back three generations, and any interactions we had with the covert side of the federal government.  My mother is Maureen Boehm nee Simpson, born 9/21/1947, and my father is Herman Boehm, born 4/7/1944.  My mother's father was Maurice Simpson, an Army scientist and unexploded ordinance technician in WWII, and my father's father was Herman Boehm, destroyer watch in WWII, captain of the buoy tender The Dahlia in the Coast Guard and one of the men who extinguished the Hindenberg.  My mother's mother was Doris Simpson nee Gardner and my father's mother was Adelaide Boehm.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Boehm

communications.subject: FOIA Request 119346
communications.communication:
Dear Brian Boehm:

Attached is your completed FOIA request. NSA considers your request to be satisfied and, accordingly, your request is being closed at this time.

Please follow the instructions provided to you within the letter if you wish to contact us. Please do not respond to this email.

NSA Freedom of Information Division
(301) 688-6527

files.title: FOIA Request 119346
files.source: National Security Agency, United States of America

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Shimon Peres FBI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Shimon Peres (Hebrew: שמעון פרס‎‎; born Szymon Perski; 2 August 1923 – 28 September 2016) was a Polish-born Israeli statesman. He was the ninth President of Israel, serving from 2007 to 2014. Peres served twice as the Prime Minister of Israel and twice as Interim Prime Minister, and he was a member of 12 cabinets in a political career spanning over 66 years. His death has been widely reported. http://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/28/world/middleeast/shimon-peres-dies-israel.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the Bureau for AND Magazine, MuckRock and Glomar Disclosure. My articles have been widely read, with some reaching over 100,000 readers. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Michael Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request: Shimon Peres FBI
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Best,

The FBI has received your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy (FOIPA) request and it will be forwarded to Initial Processing for review.   Your request will be processed under the provisions of FOIPA and a response will be mailed to you at a later date.

Requests for fee waivers and expedited processing will be addressed once your request has been assigned an FOIPA request number. You will receive written notification of the FBI’s decision.

Information regarding the Freedom of Information Act/Privacy is available at https://www.fbi.gov<http://www.fbi.gov>/, by clicking on the SERVICES link at the top of the homepage and then click on the Freedom of Information Act/Privacy picture, or the direct link is: https://www.fbi.gov/services/records-management/foia, or by accessing the U. S. Department of Justice at https://www.justice.gov/oip.  If you require additional assistance please contact us at foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

Thank you,


David P. Sobonya
Public Information Officer/GIS
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS)
FBI-Records Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA  22602-4843
Ofc:  (540) 868-4593
Direct: (540) 868-4286
Fax: (540) 868-4391/4997

communications.communication:
Dear Mr.Best,



Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps, and follow the instructions below.



Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov>.



FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- LAST UPDATED ON November 2, 2016



Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]



FOIPA:

Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:

FOIPA:

1234567-000

Case Type:

FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.
NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Thank you,


Holly Early

title: Jenniffer González Colón Letters to USACE

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jenniffer González Colón Letters to USACE
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents obtained through a FOIA sent to USACE's Jacksonville District, show that Jenniffer González Colón sent at least one letter to USACE in hopes of speeding up the approval of a Jurisdictional Determination (JD). The letter can be found here: https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/24805241-20230315-letter-gonzalez-colon-to-usace-jax?responsive=1&title=1

Therefore I request the following:

1) Every letter that Jenniffer González Colón or her office has sent to USACE's Jacksonville District. It's likely that these letters were sent to Col. James Booth, District Commander of USACE's Jacksonville District, and/or Mr. Howard Gonzales, Deputy District Engineer for Programs and Project Management for USACE's Jacksonville District.

Keywords: "Jenniffer González Colon" "tourism" "residential" "development" "JGO" "Puerto Rico"

This request is for all documents produced between January 1, 2022 and the time this request is processed.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and documents from this request will be used in the course of reporting about construction projects in Puerto Rico. https://muckrack.com/carlos-e-berrios-polanco

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: RE: [Non-DoD Source] Freedom of Information Act Request: Jenniffer González Colón Letters to USACE
communications.communication:
Good morning,

This message is in regard to a FOIA request you sent to our office on July 15, 2024.  You requested "every letter Jennifer Gonzalez Colon or her office has sent to USACE's Jacksonville District."  

There is something that must be addressed before the Jacksonville District can begin the search for the records you have requested. Your request for is considered impermissibly broad and does not comply with the FOIA's requirement that requests for records reasonably describe the records you are seeking. Your request, as written, would not allow professional agency employees familiar with the subject area to locate the records with a “reasonable amount of effort.”  It is the requester’s responsibility to identify the records they seek, and the records must be described in a manner that enables our record holders to locate the records with a reasonable amount of effort. Therefore, it is most helpful to us if a requester provides very specific, descriptive information about the records they seek. All of the records related to a Corps project are not maintained in a single file or location. Each office/department maintains its own records based on the issues or matters for which it is involved.  Additionally, present archival systems do not allow us to ensure an adequate search for records using such broad criteria. Therefore, for us to locate all "every letter Jennifer Gonzalez Colon or her office has sent to USACE's Jacksonville District" as instructed in your request, we would have to request that every employee within the Jacksonville District search all of their electronic and hard copy records located within their purview to see if they have records that relate in any way possible to your request. This type of extensive search would involve many employees and would involve many hours of search time.  Please provide more specific information so that a reasonable search for records can be done.  Our office will not be able to assist you with your request until you narrow the scope of what you are seeking.

We will keep this matter in a pending status, but if we don't receive an amended request by August 8, 2024, we will close the file and take no further action.

If you have any questions or need additional information, please let us know.

Thank you,

FOIA ADMINISTRATOR
U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Jacksonville District
701 San Marco Blvd.
Jacksonville, FL 32207-8175
ph:  904-232-2477

ATTENTION:  PLEASE CONTACT OUR OFFICE DIRECTLY BY E-MAIL AT FOIA-SAJ@USACE.ARMY.MIL WITH ANY QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS. TO ENSURE YOUR REQUEST IS RECEIVED AND PROCESSED EXPEDITIOUSLY, IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT FOIA REQUESTS BE E-MAILED TO OUR OFFICE AT FOIA-SAJ@USACE.ARMY.MIL.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jenniffer González Colón Letters to USACE
communications.communication:
Hello,

Hope your day is going well.

Given that my request contains the person who sent the communication and the people most likely to have received them, what is the best way to narrow down my request so as not to burden your office? Would it be best I asked just to search the records of USACE Jacksonville's District Commander and District Engineer?

Best wishes,
Carlos

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Outed Soviet spies unredacted
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

An unredacted copy of the original document declassified and released in 1999 as CIA-RDP78-00915R000700260037-6.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000 readers in outlets such as MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, AND Magazine, Unicorn Riot, and more. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the fles online and make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and and the journalist non-profit, MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

Additionally, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the released information to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v. Dep’t of Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had “frm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.

Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee category.

As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best
An acknowledgement letter, stating the request is being processed.

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Clallam County WA public records request #24-748
communications.communication:
Clallam County WA ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #24-748: Dear Rose Terse, The Clallam County Sheriff's Office writes to acknowledge receipt of the public records request you submitted on 05/31/2024. Please accept this correspondence as our timely response to your request as required under RCW 42.56.520. REQUEST To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: Regarding the Clallam County commissioners' plan to purchase 4Sight Labs medical monitoring bracelets (https://www.peninsuladailynews.com/news/clallam-to-buy-monitoring-bracelets-for-inmates/), please provide: 1. All brochures, manuals, and other informational and/or promotional materials about 4Sight Labs and its products 2. All emails, text messages, and other communications with 4Sight Labs since 9/1/2024 The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, Rose Terse Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcallam-county-33297%252F4sight-labs-medical-monitoring-bracelets-164464%252F%253Femail%253DWeb_PRO%252540clallamcountywa.gov&url_auth_token=AAHvIAKwuF-bb7RmVNtL3csLlKw%3A1sDHqi%3ADTvyoW3mKscsEAFd3NLd03pUjWsQu2MOJ2HMOzPzsD8 RESPONSE We anticipate that either the requested records or a first installment of records should be available on or before 07/02/2024. This preliminary estimate takes into account, among other things, the need to locate and assemble the record(s) requested, notify third persons or agencies affected by the request, and determine whether any record(s) must be redacted in whole or in part. This estimate also takes into account the number of public records requests currently being processed. In the event that we require additional time in which to respond, we will notify you. Please note that the Sheriff's Office reserves the right to utilize an installment methodology in responding to your requests. This methodology is authorized pursuant to RCW 42.56.080. In the event that we elect to utilize an installment methodology, then the above noted estimate should be interpreted as applying to the production of a first installment of records and not interpreted as the estimated date by which we will have completed processing the request. Note that Pursuant Clallam County Policy 321.17, fees for records requests shall be waived when the total fee for the request is under ten dollars. After a request has reached $10, an invoice will be generated for records released previously along with the current installment.  To request 911 Dispatcher records, please contact PenCom directly by emailing pencom@cityofpa.us or by calling (360) 452-4545. If you have any questions, please contact the Sheriff's Office by responding to this message or by using the contact information below.  Sincerely, Aubree Johnson Public Records Deputy Clallam County Sheriff’s Office Phone: (360) 504-1262 ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Clallam County WA.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: [Document Released to Requester] Clallam County WA public records request #24-748
communications.communication:
Clallam County WA ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #24-748 along with the following message: Following a reasonable search, Clallam County has completed the assembly and duplication of an installment of identifiable public records that respond to your request. This installment is now available to you in the Records Center. You can now log in to access these records. We estimate that the next installment of records will be available to you on or around 07/30/2024. Pursuant Clallam County Policy 321.17, fees for records requests shall be waived when the total fee for the request is under ten dollars. Since the total fee for this request is under ten dollars, no payment is due at this time. Pursuant to the Clallam County Administrative Policies and Procedures, any person who objects to the partial denial or redaction of a request for a Public Record may petition the Public Records Officer for a review of that decision. The petition must be in writing and include the petitioner’s name and contact information. The petition must be filed within 10 days of the denial. Please note that if an installment of a records request is not claimed or reviewed, we are not obligated to fulfill the balance of the request, per RCW 42.56.120(4). If this installment is not claimed or reviewed within 30 days, this request may be closed. Please contact the Public Records Office if you have any questions or if you have difficultly accessing the electronic records. communications.subject: [Document Released to Requester] Clallam County WA public records request #24-748
communications.communication:
Clallam County WA ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #24-748 along with the following message: Following a reasonable search, Clallam County has completed the assembly and duplication of all identifiable public records that respond to your request. At this time, we believe that we have responded to your request in full by making the records available to you in the Records Center. This request is now closed. As such, we do not intend to further address this request and the PRA's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run. If you believe that there are other records in existence that should have been released to you in response to this request, please notify the Public Records Office as soon as possible. Pursuant Clallam County Policy 321.17, fees for records requests shall be waived when the total fee for the request is under ten dollars. Since the total fee for this request is under ten dollars, no payment is due at this time. The Public Records Office has attempted to apply consistent redactions on documents that contain the same information. In the event that you locate documents that contain redactions that are not applied consistently, please contact the Public Records Office. Please also contact the Public Records Office if you believe records were improperly redacted or withheld. Pursuant to the Clallam County Administrative Policies and Procedures, any person who objects to the partial denial or redaction of a request for a Public Record may petition the Public Records Officer for a review of that decision. The petition must be in writing and include the petitioner’s name and contact information. The petition must be filed within 10 days of the denial. If you have difficulty downloading your records, click HERE for assistance. Please contact the Public Records Office if you have any questions or if you have difficultly accessing the electronic records. You can reach our office by responding to this message or by calling the phone number below. communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Applications for Transportation, June 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Provide records sufficient to show from June 1, 2024 to June 30, 2024:

1. The number of Application for Transportation Service requests, aka "White Forms", submitted;
2. The number of students who have accepted transportation reimbursement stipends;
3. Special Education Students Missing Active Transportation Request - anonymized aggregated students including type of transportation.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15925

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
October 8, 2024 Miriam Bhimani RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N015925-073024 Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: Provide records sufficient to show from June 1, 2024 to June 30, 2024: 
1. The number of Application for Transportation Service requests, aka "White Forms", submitted; 
3. Special Education Students Missing Active Transportation Request - anonymized aggregated students including type of transportation. RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that the number included is for transportation requests submitted in Aspen, not the number of White Forms submitted as the District does not centrally house or track the White Forms. Also, be advised that some schools use “white forms” differently as transportation terminology may differ from school to school. 2. The number of students who have accepted transportation reimbursement stipends; RESPONSE: 7,177. If you have any questions, please contact our office at (773) 553-3500. 
Thank you for your request. Sincerely, 
Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: [Arizona Superintendent of Public Instruction] UNICEF and Amnesty International

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: [Arizona Superintendent of Public Instruction] UNICEF and Amnesty International
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications sent by, or received from, Superintendent of Public Instruction Tom Horne or the Deputy Superintendent which mentions "UNICEF", "United Nations", or "Amnesty". This request is limited to records generated on or after October 20, 2023.

2. A copy of all drafts of the communication sent by Tom Horne to "all district superintendents" concerning UNICEF and Amnesty International, as referenced in a November 9, 2023, press release: https://www.azed.gov/communications/horne-warns-schools-avoid-antisemitic-and-anti-american-unicef-and-amnesty.

3. Any communications received from a school district or superintendent in response to the communication referenced in Request No. 2.

Records maintained on personal devices or services. Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The term “COMMUNICATIONS” means and includes any of the following means of communication: emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, facsimile transmissions, voice memos, voicemails, voice recordings, video recordings, recordings made by Zoom (or similar meeting software), calendar entries, and calendar invitations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Re: [Request ID :##149185##] : New Request from Steinbaugh, Adam
communications.communication:
Dear Adam,

Thank you for reaching out to the Arizona Department of Education.

Data Governance is experiencing high volume of requests and working towards filling requests as soon as we can. Wait times vary depending on how extensive your request is.

Please indicate your ideal timeline. We will update the ticket and after our initial review of the information requested, we will be able to let you know if we can meet your timeline.

Have a great day,
​
The Data Governance Team


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Category : Data Request

Description : Please see attached pdf for ticket details.




NOTICE: This e-mail (and any attachments) may contain PRIVILEGED OR CONFIDENTIAL information and is intended only for the use of the specific individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may contain information that is privileged and confidential under state and federal law. This information may be used or disclosed only in accordance with law, and you may be subject to penalties under law for improper use or further disclosure of the information in this e-mail and its attachments. If you have received this e-mail in error, please immediately notify the person named above by reply e-mail, and then delete the original e-mail. Thank you.

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Mug Shot (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

My name is Catina Washington. I am requesting for a mug shot for inmate 141387/Phillip Fredinburg. He was arrested and released on April 2, 2024. I Pull up the former president, Donald Trump’s and O.J. Simpson’s mug shot, but I can’t pull up his. Please help me in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Catina Washington

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ascension St John
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sir/Madam: This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I request that a copy of the following document(s) be provided to me:  All records, Investigations, notes, and emails, regarding the FLSA & Pump Act, Department of Labor investigation of Ascension St John Medical Center, located at 1923 S Utica Ave, Tulsa, OK 74104 and 7501 Riverside Pkwy, Tulsa, OK 74136 for the time period/year of 01JAN24 to 09SEP24.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nate

title: Department of Homeland Security support for "Into the Wild" (2007)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Homeland Security support for "Into the Wild" (2007)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the production of the 2007 movie "Into the Wild," directed by Sean Penn and starring Emile Hirsch. I have attached a list of DHS film and TV collaborations obtained by another researcher to show that DHS supported this production. I request any and all documents pertaining to DHS support for "Into the Wild." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the DHS and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Into the Wild," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Department of Homeland Security support for "Contraband" (2012)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Homeland Security support for "Contraband" (2012)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the production of the 2012 movie "Contraband," directed by Baltasar Kormakur and starring Mark Wahlberg. I have attached a list of DHS film and TV collaborations obtained by another researcher to show that DHS supported this production. I request any and all documents pertaining to DHS support for "Contraband." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the DHS and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Contraband," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the Al Otro Lado #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative, we respectfully request all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. Specifically, we seek emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/brazilian-man-ice-custody-passes-away-new-mexico-hospital?s=09
and here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/nicaraguan-man-ice-custody-passes-away-colorado-hospital

By definition, the information requested cannot be subject to withholding under Exemption 7A (open investigations), because ICE has already released its core facts publicly.

We seek expedited processing of this request under 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), and make the following statements under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 in support thereof: 
1. Both the Torrance in-custody death and the Aurora in-custody death have been met with calls from elected Representatives and Senators for vigorous investigation, based on each facility's documented track record. See https://www.heinrich.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/heinrich-leads-request-for-immediate-action-from-ice-to-address-inhumane-unsafe-conditions-for-migrants-at-the-torrance-county-detention-facility and https://crow.house.gov/sites/evo-subsites/crow.house.gov/files/evo-media-document/2022.10.21-final-icedhs-letter_0.pdf. 

2. Both deaths have been the subject of widespread and sustained media attention. 
For Torrance: 
https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/22/us/politics/aclu-ice-immigration-detention.html
https://sourcenm.com/2022/09/01/brazilian-asylum-seeker-who-died-by-suicide-held-in-horrific-conditions-attorneys-say/
https://nmpoliticalreport.com/2022/08/31/immigrant-advocacy-organizations-seeking-answers-around-brazilian-mans-death-by-suicide-while-in-ice-custody/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/10/18/headlines/asylum_seekers_at_torrance_ice_jail_claim_retaliation_over_hunger_strike
https://theappeal.org/torrance-detention-center-kesley-vial-brazil/
https://www.santafenewmexican.com/opinion/letters_to_editor/close-torrance-county-ice-facility-now/article_08a7cf58-5705-11ed-b432-1bb650ab5a32.html
https://www.krqe.com/news/crime/man-commits-suicide-in-ice-custody-in-torrance-county/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/8/29/headlines/asylum_seeker_dies_by_suicide_at_for_profit_ice_jail_in_new_mexico
https://www.abqjournal.com/2528527/webhedline-126.html
https://www.lcsun-news.com/story/news/local/new-mexico/2022/09/30/groups-retaliation-after-migrants-report-torrance-county-detention-center/69530415007/

For Aurora: 
https://www.cpr.org/2022/10/27/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-investigation-into-death-at-aurora-ice-facility/
https://www.cpr.org/2022/11/03/advocates-immigration-customs-enforcement-custody-death/
https://www.9news.com/article/news/local/man-nicaragua-dies-aurora-ice-facility/73-f52d0d45-531c-4e17-a361-1376d887e499
https://www.denver7.com/news/local-news/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-probe-after-detainees-death-at-aurora-ice-facility
https://www.cbsnews.com/colorado/news/melvin-ariel-calero-mendoza-nicaraguan-father-dies-ice-custody-aurora-facility/
https://www.longmontleader.com/local-news/el-comite-wants-answers-to-ice-detention-death-5990654
https://news.yahoo.com/video/nicaraguan-father-two-dies-ice-040542382.html
https://www.newsbreak.com/news/2810691040469/report-details-what-led-up-to-man-s-death-in-aurora-ice-custody

3. In both cases, serious questions have been raised by elected officials as to the circumstances surrounding each person's death, and ICE and its contractors' compliance with mandatory duties surrounding care of detained immigrants. 

Therefore, the requirements of 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) are satisfied, and expedited processing is proper. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this important request, and your response within the statutorily required 10-calendar day period! 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative
Al Otro Lado

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
12/21/2022Andrew FreeMuckRock News, DEPT MR136588Boston, Massachusetts 02115RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462        Dear Requester:This acknowledges receipt of your 11/8/2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. .  Your request was received in this office on 11/8/2022.After careful review of your FOIA request, we determined that your request is 1) too broad in scope, 2) did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking, or 3) only posed questions to the agency.  Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency.  For this reason, §5.3(b) of the DHS regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort.  Whenever possible, a request should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipients, and subject matter of the records, if known, or the ICE program office you believe created and/or controls the record.  The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records.  Please resubmit your request containing a reasonable description of the records you are seeking.  Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request.If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed.  Please be advised that this action is not a denial of your request and will not preclude you from filing other requests in the future. If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Marcus Francis at (866) 633-1182 or the address above.Your request has been assigned reference number 2023-ICFO-03462. Sincerely,ICE-FOIA 
This message (including any attachments) contains confidential information intended for a specific individual and purpose, and is protected by law. If you are not the intended recipient, you should delete this message and any disclosure, copying, or distribution
 of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, by you is strictly prohibited. 
Deloitte refers to a Deloitte member firm, one of its related entities, or Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited ("DTTL"). Each Deloitte member firm is a separate legal entity and a member of DTTL. DTTL does not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about
 to learn more. 
v.E.1

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
We appeal the agency’s determination that the request is improper. 

It seeks:

“emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted [on ICE’s website].”

We seek expedited processing of this request for the reasons described in our original submission. 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

Your appeal, postmarked or electronically transmitted on 12/23/2022, was received on 1/5/2023.The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2023-ICAP-00243 for tracking purposes.  Please reference this number in any future communications about your appeal.A high number of FOIA/PA requests have been received by the Department. communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 8, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #2023-ICAP-00243.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
You have reached SecureRelease Support.

The purpose of this inbox is to provide technical support for the SecureRelease FOIA Request Portal website (https://www.securerelease.us/).

SecureRelease website support staff are not involved with the processing or prioritization of requests, and this inbox is not monitored by agency personnel.

According to our records, request 2023-ICAP-00243 was not submitted through the SecureRelease Request Portal, therefore, we are unable to provide online status tracking or portal messaging capabilities for this request.

We have CC’ed the ICE FOIA inbox for visibility. To follow up further on this request, please refer to communications you received from the agency for contact instructions or reach out to the agency in the same manner that you submitted your request.

Regards,

SecureRelease™ Support Team
securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com<mailto:securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com>
www.securerelease.us<http://www.securerelease.us>

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
Good day,

In regards to 2023-ICAP+00243, we have queried the appropriate component of DHS for responsive records.  If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability.  We will process your request as expeditiously as possible.  Upon completion of the processing, all documents that can be released will be made available to you as soon as possible.

Thank you,
ICE FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
You are legally required to provide an estimated date on which documents will be produced.

You are legally required to make a determination on this request and inform us of it. 

You are legally required to make records promptly available. 

You have failed to comply with any of these requirements. 

If you have any intention of doing so within the next fourteen days, please inform us. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, 

Your assertion that “a high number of FOIA requests have been received by the Department” is unsupported by the Department’s own FY22 Chief FOIA Officer Report. In other words, you’re saying a thing that your own data demonstrate is untrue. 

But go off, I guess. 

Thank you, 

Andrew Free

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00071, 2024-ICFO-06913
communications.communication:
12/12/2023 

Andrew Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR136588 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2024-ICAP-00071, 2024-ICFO-06913 

Dear Requester: 

The Department of Homeland Security has received your letter appealing the adverse determination of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Your appeal, postmarked or electronically transmitted on 11/22/2023, was received on 12/11/2023. 

The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2024-ICAP-00071 for tracking purposes.  Please reference this number in any future communications about your appeal. 

A high number of FOIA/PA requests have been received by the Department.  Accordingly, we have adopted the court-sanctioned practice of generally handling backlogged appeals on a first-in, first-out basis.   While we will make every effort to process your appeal on a timely basis, there may be some delay in resolving this matter.  Should you have any questions concerning the processing of your appeal, please contact Fernando Pineiro Jr., ICE FOIA Office/Public Liaison at (866) 633-1182 or at 500 12th St., SW Washington, DC 20536-5009. 

Sincerely, 
 
Sara Jazayeri 
Acting Chief 
Government Information Law Division 
ICE Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security

RE:	ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00162 
 
Dear Requester: 

This email is in response to your status inquiry regarding ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00162, in which you have requested Appeal. This will capture the combined time frame for records from April 1, 2021, through December 15, 2023.. 

As of today, the search for responsive documents is complete and your request is currently in queue to be processed. If responsive records have been located, they will be reviewed for a determination of releasability. 

ICE FOIA apologizes for the delay in the processing of your request. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Daniel Edgington at the address above or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2024-ICAP-00162. Please use this number in future correspondence. 

Sincerely,

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00127
communications.communication:
08/12/2024 

Andrew Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR136588 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2024-ICAP-00127 

Dear Requester: 

This letter is the final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Appeal on remand. You had appealed an adverse determination of your request dated 1/23/2024. 

We have considered your request under the both the FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the Privacy Act Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a.  After review of the documents, I have determined that portions of documents will be withheld pursuant to Exemption 6 of the Privacy Act and Exemptions 7 of the FOIA as described below. 

FOIA Exemption 5 protects from disclosure those inter- or intra-agency documents that are normally privileged in the civil discovery context.  The three most frequently invoked privileges are the deliberative process privilege, the attorney work-product privilege, and the attorney-client privilege.  After carefully reviewing the responsive documents, I have determined that portions of the responsive documents qualify for protection under the deliberative process privilege/ attorney work-product privilege/ attorney-client privilege/ or all three.  The deliberative process privilege protects the integrity of the deliberative or decision-making processes within the agency by exempting from mandatory disclosure opinions, conclusions, and recommendations included within inter-agency or intra-agency memoranda or letters.  The release of this internal information would discourage the expression of candid opinions and inhibit the free and frank exchange of information among agency personnel. The attorney work-product privilege protects documents and other memoranda prepared by an attorney in contemplation of litigation. 

FOIA Exemption 6 exempts from disclosure personnel or medical files and similar files the release of which would cause a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  This requires a balancing of the public’s right to disclosure against the individual’s right privacy.  The types of documents and/or information that we have withheld may consist of social security numbers, home addresses, dates of birth, or various other documents and/or information belonging to a third party that are considered personal.  The privacy interests of the individuals in the records you have requested outweigh any minimal public interest in disclosure of the information.  Any private interest you may have in that information does not factor into the aforementioned balancing test. 

FOIA Exemption 7(C) protects records or information compiled for law enforcement purposes that could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  This exemption takes particular note of the strong interests of individuals, whether they are suspects, witnesses, or investigators, in not being unwarrantably associated with alleged criminal activity.  That interest extends to persons who are not only the subjects of the investigation, but those who may have their privacy invaded by having their identities and information about them revealed in connection with an investigation.  Based upon the traditional recognition of strong privacy interest in law enforcement records, categorical withholding of information that identifies third parties in law enforcement records is ordinarily appropriate.  As such, I have determined that the privacy interest in the identities of individuals in the records you have requested clearly outweigh any minimal public interest in disclosure of the information.  Please note that any private interest you may have in that information does not factor into this determination. 

Exemption 7(E) protects records compiled for law enforcement purposes, the release of which would disclose techniques and/or procedures for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions, or would disclose guidelines for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions if such disclosure could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law.  I determined that disclosure of law enforcement systems checks could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law.  Additionally, the techniques and procedures at issue are not well known to the public. 

If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Daniel Edgington at (866) 633-1182 or 500 12th St., SW Stop 5009 Washington, DC 20536-5009. 

Sincerely, 

Supervisory Paralegal Specialist

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Personnel Records, Title IX + OIG
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

* Camie Pratt, previous Title IX manager
* Will Fletcher, previous OIG inspector
* Elizabeth Mendoza Browne, current Title IX manager
* Amber Nesbitt, interim OIG 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

This request is on behalf of The FOIA Bakery, an Illinois nonprofit. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.
